messages.title: THE TORIES HAVE FAILED WORKING PEOPLE.
messages.content: Working families are set to be an average of £1,400 a year worse off by 2020 due to tax and social security changes. Living standards have declined with real wages lower now than they were in 2010. 5.7 million people are in jobs that pay less than the Living Wage, too many of the jobs that are being created are in low-paid, insecure work.

messages.title: THE TORY ECONOMY IS HOLDING PEOPLE BACK.
messages.content: Under the Tories working families will be on average over £1,400 a year worse off.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Working families are set to be an average of £1,400 a year worse off by 2020 due to tax and social security changes.

issues.economy: Working families are set to be an average of £1,400 a year worse off by 2020 due to tax and social security changes. Under the Tories working families will be on average over £1,400 a year worse off.

images.caption: Calculator with the display of negative 1,400, symbolizing families being worse off.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet criticizes the opposing party, the Tories, for their economic record, particularly for the impact on working families. Actual policy proposals from the Labour party are not detailed in the leaflet provided.
